Kalabox Hands-on Debugging

August 19, 2015

Kalabox Debugging

A few helpful commands while debugging and doing Kalabox development.

  • SSH into the VM to do things
boot2docker --vm="Kalabox2" ssh
  • Add DOCKER_HOST variables to your .bash_profile
export DOCKER_CERT_PATH=
export DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY=1
export DOCKER_HOST=tcp://10.13.37.42:2376

With these environmental variables you won’t need to SSH into the VM to run “docker” commands. Note that in some weird cases, the ip might be 10.13.37.43. You can check this by running “kbox ip”.

  • Remove a rogue container manually
docker ps
docker rm -f [container name]
  • See your files directory
docker ps
docker inspect [container name]
docker exec -i -t [container name] bash
cd /data
  • Build an image from a dockerfile
docker build -t [user/repo:version] .
  • Keep a temporary container running
docker run -it --name [container-name] [image-name] /bin/bash
  • Update a docker image on DockerHub Manually
docker build -t [dockerhub-username/repo:version] .
docker push [dockerhub-username/repo:version]
Kalabox, Docker, products
